<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>It’s the Saturday of Labor Day Weekend and the final day of August, so you know what that means: some Brew housekeeping is in order.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/198/broom_1f9f9.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""> Our exclusive Sunday newsletter Light Roast will be moved to Monday and won’t be exclusive at all. Everyone will receive it, not just readers with 3+ referrals. </p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRADE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/30/us-consumers-face-biggest-test-yet-tariffs-take-hold?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
U.S. Consumers Face Their Biggest Test Yet
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="U.S. Consumers Face Their Biggest Test Yet" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=447 src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1567201272.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="U.S. Consumers Face Their Biggest Test Yet" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1567201272.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Starting at 12:01am Sunday, 15% tariffs on about $112 billion in Chinese goods will <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-08-30/u-s-china-locked-in-stare-down-as-new-tariffs-set-for-weekend?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">go into effect</a>. The import tax will affect more than 3,200 categories of products, including all the <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/business/business-news/kiddie-pools-popsicle-sticks-next-round-tariffs-labor-day-killjoy-n1048271?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ingredients</a> for a perfect backyard BBQ: meat, mustard, and plastic plates.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">This time is different </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">President Trump has already slapped tariffs on $250 billion worth of Chinese products. But since many of those goods only get passed between manufacturers, you may not have felt the effects. When was the last time you went shopping for carbon electrodes?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"><em>This </em></strong><strong style="color:#000">round has a boatload of consumer products</strong>—literally, canoe paddles are being taxed. Also: footwear, apparel, smartwatches, TVs, sporting goods, diapers, and a whole lot more. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>29% of consumer goods Americans get from China are currently subject to tariffs. Tomorrow, that’ll spike to 69%, </span><span><a href="https://apnews.com/3b21f8af2045410581e0af41661fb7a5?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">per the AP</a></span><span>. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Once increased tariffs on more Chinese goods go into effect on Dec. 15, almost all consumer goods we buy from China will be staring down tariffs. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Business groups are having a tough time swallowing this</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The CEO of the U.S. Chamber of Commerce: </strong>"The <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/opinions/lift-the-tariffs-and-restart-trade-talks-with-china-now/2019/08/29/c3fce2fc-ca63-11e9-a1fe-ca46e8d573c0_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">current path</a> of constant escalation doesn’t increase the likelihood of a deal; it risks a recession here at home."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Footwear Distributors and Retailers of America: </strong>"Brands have already said tariffs will <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/08/28/politics/adidas-nike-crocs-china-tariff-letter/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dent job growth</a> and shoe stores are saying it's a job killer."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Director of the University of Michigan survey on consumer sentiment: </strong>"The <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-08-30/u-s-consumer-sentiment-falls-most-since-2012-on-tariff-concern?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">recent decline</a> is due to negative references to tariffs, which were spontaneously mentioned by one in three consumers."</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">President Trump’s response:</strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"><img src="https://morningbrew-oslo.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/1567193262.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em><sup class="sub-text"><a href="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1167439383932391425?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">@realDonaldTrump</a></sup></em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Loyal Brew readers know that consumers have been powering the U.S. economy. But it’s clear that after this latest round of tariffs, retailers will have no choice but to raise prices on some goods. The question now is what happens when an unstoppable economic force meets an immovable tariff object?</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CYBERSECURITY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/30/googles-project-zero-discovered-nasty-vulnerability-iphone-software?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Apple & Google: SVU
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In cybersecurity, “zero day” vulnerabilities are considered especially heinous. In Silicon Valley, the elite squad of privacy researchers who investigate these vicious design flaws are known as Project Zero. These are their stories. <em>Dun dun.</em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Fresh off hitting “send” on the e-vites for its Sept. 10 iPhone event, Apple (and everyone else) <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-08-30/google-s-elite-hacking-team-reveals-untimely-bug-in-iphone?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">found out</a> researchers at Google’s Project Zero discovered a two-year long <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/08/30/googles-iphone-security-report-doubles-as-criticism-of-apple-privacy.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">vulnerability</a> in iPhone software.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Google’s Project Zero snoops around for so-called “zero day” vulnerabilities, or accidental design flaws that allow hackers to break into operating systems. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>These particular Apple (-0.25%) bugs </span><span><a href="https://googleprojectzero.blogspot.com/2019/08/a-very-deep-dive-into-ios-exploit.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">targeted</a></span><span> a handful of websites that, when visited, could have left possibly thousands of iPhone users per week open to malicious e-intruders seeking passwords, messages, GPS details, etc.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>As the WaPo <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/2019/08/30/google-researchers-uncover-year-iphone-hack-tied-malicious-websites/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">points out</a>, this widespread, random attack could be one of the worst iPhone hacker campaigns ever. But hackers lost access when users rebooted their phones, meaning the bad actors had limited power. Still, for Apple, the awkward timing hurts the most.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MARKETS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/30/market-roundup-august?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Wall Street’s August of Discontent
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This summer’s dog days were a little less Benji, a little more Cujo.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Stocks</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Wall St. pregamed this week’s gains with four straight weeks of losses, and August was only the <a href="https://apnews.com/364048f17a164f03a30aaeee7161d93e?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">second monthly decline</a> for stocks this year.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The trade war? Not great for stocks. </strong>U.S.-China uncertainty and concerns over global economic growth sent investors from <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/few-sectors-have-escaped-augusts-stock-market-selloff-11567100241?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">risky equities</a> into the warm embrace of…</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Bonds</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Government debt prices jumped, sending yields to historic lows. The 30-year Treasury yield dove under 2% for the first time. And the dreaded yield curve inversion became its most inverted since 2007.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now, $17 trillion of global bonds have <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/4e030886-ca97-11e9-af46-b09e8bfe60c0?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sub-zero yields</a>, meaning investors are willing to pay someone to store their money safely. And finally...</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Currencies</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">China’s yuan registered its <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/ac42f33a-ca41-11e9-af46-b09e8bfe60c0?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">biggest monthly drop</a> relative to the dollar in more than 25 years in August, down 3.8%. A weaker yuan would boost the competitiveness of Chinese exports and somewhat mute the effects of U.S. tariffs, but currency depreciation is a dangerous road to travel.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRANSPORTATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/30/dispute-ebike-enthusiasts-national-parks-boils?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Are E-Bikes too Big to Trail?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="No Alt" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MjQ3L2ViaWtlLTIyNjE5NzlfOTYwXzcyMF9qcGcuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>fbenedict/Pixabay</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">There’s a territorial dispute in U.S. national parks, and we’re not talking about the one between the pocket gophers and the yellow-bellied marmots. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Thursday, Interior Secretary David Bernhardt <a href="https://apnews.com/d22c8bb8a83c48c0b421dc0da81efd0b?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">signed an order</a> allowing motorized electric bicycles to use trails in national parks and other public lands. Conservation groups are <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-s-move-to-open-trails-to-e-bikes-prompts-backlash-11567192144?mod=hp_listc_pos5&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">angry</a> over the decision, saying the e-bikes will disrupt the experience and threaten the safety of those who solely use their muscles to enjoy the outdoors. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The government’s argument is one of access.</strong> The Deputy Director of the National Park Service said e-bikes “provide an option for people who want to ride a bicycle but might not otherwise do so because of physical fitness, age, disability or convenience.”</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Whichever side you fall on, it’s an e-xciting time for e-bikes. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Electric-assist bicycle sales </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/should-you-trade-in-your-car-for-an-e-bike-11561046444?mod=article_inline&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">increased 91%</a></span><span> from 2016 to 2017, per NPD Group. The fanciest models even sync with your smartphone and offer ride metrics (calories burned: 2). </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Those fancy models? They can go for $2,000 or more. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>an outdoors coalition is considering legal options <span>to stop the order from going into effect</span>.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F08%2F30%2Fdispute-ebike-enthusiasts-national-parks-boils" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Or, you can click on the share button below and spread the word on your platform of choice.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>This is your final chance to help us make a big difference in classrooms. </p>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThere’s a territorial dispute in U.S. national parks, and we’re not talking about the one between the pocket gophers and the yellow-bellied marmots. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Thursday, Interior Secretary David Bernhardt \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/d22c8bb8a83c48c0b421dc0da81efd0b?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esigned an order\u003c/a\u003e allowing motorized electric bicycles to use trails in national parks and other public lands. Conservation groups are \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/u-s-s-move-to-open-trails-to-e-bikes-prompts-backlash-11567192144?mod=hp_listc_pos5\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eangry\u003c/a\u003e over the decision, saying the e-bikes will disrupt the experience and threaten the safety of those who solely use their muscles to enjoy the outdoors. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe government’s argument is one of access.\u003c/strong\u003e The Deputy Director of the National Park Service said e-bikes “provide an option for people who want to ride a bicycle but might not otherwise do so because of physical fitness, age, disability or convenience.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhichever side you fall on, it’s an e-xciting time for e-bikes. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eElectric-assist bicycle sales \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/should-you-trade-in-your-car-for-an-e-bike-11561046444?mod=article_inline\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eincreased 91%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e from 2016 to 2017, per NPD Group. The fanciest models even sync with your smartphone and offer ride metrics (calories burned: 2). \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThose fancy models? They can go for $2,000 or more. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ean outdoors coalition is considering legal options \u003cspan\u003eto stop the order from going into
